statement: English has 20 short words with a lot of power.
question: Does English have 20 short words with a lot of power?
tag_question: English has 20 short words with a lot of power, doesn't it?
negation: English doesn't have 20 short words with a lot of power.

question: Are these 20 words called x-words?
tag_question: These 20 words are called x-words, aren't they?
negation: These 20 words are not called x-words.

statement: Every complete sentence in written English has an x-word.
question: Does every complete sentence in written English have an x-word?
tag_question: Every complete sentence in written English has an x-word, doesn't it?
negation: Not every complete sentence in written English has an x-word.

question: Does it take time to learn?
tag_question: It takes time to learn, doesn't it?
negation: It doesn't take time to learn.

question: Does memorizing the x-words come first?
tag_question: Memorizing the x-words comes first, doesn't it?
negation: Memorizing the x-words does not come first.
